_meanings:
{@--3@} Fit to be 
worshipped or honoured.

{@--5@} A
title affixed to the names of 
Brāhmaṇas; as in {#goviMdadeva, puruzottamadeva#}
&c.

{@--11@} A man following any
particular business.

{2} an epithet of (1)
Śiva. (2) Buddha. (3) Viṣṇu.

an attendant or follower of
a god.

{1} the food
of gods, divine food, ambrosia.

{1} liked by or dear to
gods.

{2} sacred or dedicated to a
deity.

the garden of gods, the Nandana
garden; <ls>R. 10. 80.</ls>

an 
epithet of {#uccEHSravas#}, the horse of 
Indra.

‘the garden of the
gods,’ Nandana garden.

{2} a low Brāhmaṇa 
subsisting by attendance upon an idol
and upon the offerings made to it.

an epithet of 
Bṛhaspati, preceptor of the gods.

an epithet of (1) 
Indra. (2) Śiva. (3) Viṣṇu. (4)
Brahman.

<ab>N.</ab> of Durgā; also
of Devakī, mother of Kṛṣṇa.

{1} a 
deified saint, divine sage, such as {#atri#}, 

{#Bfgu, pulastya, aMgiras#} &c., {#evaMvAdini#}
{#devarzO#} <ls>Ku. 6. 84</ls> ({%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} {#aMgiras#}).

an epithet
of Sarasvatī or of a place situated
on it.

{1} a secret only known
by gods.

the 
worship or service of gods.

(<ab>du.</ab>) Aśvins, the twin physicians
of gods.

a pearl-necklace having
a hundred strings.

{2} one
of the trees of paradise, ({%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} {#maMdAra#},
{#pArijAta, saMtAna, kalpa#}, and {#haricaMdana#}).

{1} the right moment for the
worship of gods.

{2} the tips of the
fingers sacred to gods.

{2}
given to the gods (as a village, &c.).

{2} a
certain person (used in speaking
of men indefinitely); {#devadattaH#} 
{#pacati, pIno devadatto divA na BuMkte#} &c.

a servant
or attendant upon a temple.

{1} a female in the service of gods or
a temple.

{2} a courtezan (employed
as a dancer in a temple).

{2} the
holy basil with red flowers.

a divine
envoy or messenger, an angel.

<ab>N.</ab> of
the character in which Sanskrit is
usually written.

‘the
royal feet or presence,’ an honorific
term for a king; {#devapAdAH pramARam#}.

any animal consecrated to a
deity.

an epithet of 
Amarāvatī, the city of Indra.

an idol, the image of a
deity.

‘dear to the gods’, an epithet of
Śiva; {#devAnAMpriyaH#} an irreg. <ab>comp.</ab>
meaning

{2} a fool, idiot
like a brute beast, as in  
{#tepyatAtparyajYA devAnAMpriyAH#} <ls>K. P.</ls>

{1} the heaven.
{2} a temple. 
{3} the holy fig-tree.

{3} a curl of
hair on a horse's neck.

a sacrificial place,
a place where a sacrifice is 
performed; {#devayajanasaMBave sIte#} <ls>U. 4.</ls>

a sacrifice to the superior gods made
by oblations to fire, or through fire
to the gods; (one of the five
daily sacrifices of a Brāhmaṇa; see
<ls>Ms. 3. 81</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 3.">85</ls>; and {#paMcayajYa#} also).

‘an idol-procession’, any sacred
festival when the idols are 
carried in procession.

{1} the first of the
four ages of the world; also called
{#kftayuga#}.

{2} an age of the gods 
comprising four ages of men.

{3} fuel
used in kindling fire; ({%<ab>f.</ab>%} also).

the Navamallikā or
double jasmine plant.

the
image or statue of a deity.

‘a divine voice’, a voice from
heaven.

{2} the
science of Nirukta or etymology.

{1} a religious observance, any
religious vow.

{2} the favourite 

food of the gods.

an epithet of 
Saramā, the bitch of the gods.

the 
remnants of a sacrifice offered to gods.

{2} a council of a king,
council-chamber.

identification or unification with a deity
conjunction with the gods, deification.

a
tube or cavity (in the heart) leading
to the gods; <ab>cf.</ab> {#udAna#}.

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of the wife of
Skanda; {#skaMdena sAkzAdiva devasenAM#}  
<ls>R. 7. 1</ls>; (<ls>Malli.</ls>:-- {#devasenA#} = {#skaMdapatnI#}; perhaps
it merely means ‘the army of the
gods’ personified as Skanda's wife).

‘property of gods,’ 
property applicable to religious 
purposes or endowments; {#yadDanaM#} 
{#yajYaSIlAnAM devasvaM tadvidurbuDAH#} <ls>Ms. 11. 20</ls>,
<ls n="Ms. 11.">26.</ls>

an
animal offered to gods at a 
sacrifice.

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of a daughter of Manu
Svāyambhuva and wife of Kardama.
